verses.text: He that liveth for ever created all \add things\add* in general.
The Lord only is righteous, And there is none other but he,
Who governeth the world with the palm of his hand, And all \add things\add* obey his will: For he \add is\add* the King of all, by his power Dividing holy \add things\add* among them from profane.
To whom hath he given power to declare his works? And who shall find out his noble acts?
Who shall number the strength of his majesty? And who shall also tell out his mercies?

\add As for\add* the wondrous works of the Lord, there may nothing be taken from \add them\add*, Neither may any thing be put unto \add them\add*, neither can the ground \add of them\add* be found out.
When a man hath done, then he beginneth; And when he leaveth off, then he shall be doubtful.
What \add is\add* man, and whereto serveth he? What \add is\add* his good, and what \add is\add* his evil?
The number of a manâ€™s days at the most \add are\add* an hundred years.
As a drop of water unto the sea, and a gravel stone \add in comparison of\add* the sand; So \add are\add* a thousand years to the days of eternity.
Therefore is God patient with them, And poureth forth his mercy upon them.
He saw and perceived their end to be evil; Therefore he multiplied his compassion.
The mercy of man \add is\add* toward his neighbour; But the mercy of the Lord \add is\add* upon all flesh: He reproveth, and nurtureth, and teacheth, And bringeth again, as a shepherd his flock.
He hath mercy on them that receive discipline, And that diligently seek after his judgments.
\add My\add* son, blemish not \add thy\add* good \add deeds\add*, Neither \add use\add* uncomfortable words when \add thou\add* givest any thing.
Shall not the dew asswage the heat? So \add is\add* a word better than a gift.
Lo, \add is\add* not a word better than a gift? But both \add are\add* with a gracious man.
A fool will upbraid churlishly, And a gift of the envious consumeth the eyes.
Learn before \add thou\add* speak, And use physick or ever thou be sick.
Before judgment examine thyself, And in the day of visitation thou shalt find mercy.
Humble thyself before thou be sick, And in the time of sins shew repentance.
Let nothing hinder thee to pay \add thy\add* vow in due time, And defer not until death to be justified.
Before \add thou\add* prayest, prepare thyself; And be not as one that tempteth the Lord.
Think upon the wrath that shall be at the end, And the time of vengeance, when \add he\add* shall turn away \add his\add* face.
When \add thou\add* hast enough, remember the time of hunger: And when \add thou\add* art rich, \add think upon\add* poverty and need.
From the morning until the evening the time is changed, And all \add things\add* are soon \add done\add* before the Lord.
A wise man will fear in every \add thing\add*, And in the day of sinning he will beware of offence: But a fool will not observe time.
Every man of understanding knoweth wisdom, And will give praise unto him that found her.
\add They that were\add* of understanding in sayings became also wise themselves, And poured forth exquisite parables.
Go not after thy lusts, But refrain thyself from thine appetites.
If thou givest thy soul the desires that please \add her\add*, She will make thee a laughingstock to thine enemies that malign thee.
Take not pleasure in much good cheer, Neither be tied to the expence thereof.
Be not made a beggar by banqueting upon borrowing, When thou hast nothing in \add thy\add* purse: For thou shalt lie in wait for thine own life, \add and be\add* talked on.
